00036 g2m::g2m() {
00037   //cout << "g2m ctor" << endl;
00038   QMenu* myMenu = new QMenu("gcode");
00039   
00040   QAction* myAction = new QAction ( "Create 3D Model...", this );
00041   myAction->setShortcut(QString("Ctrl+M"));
00042   myAction->setStatusTip ( "Load a .ngc file and create a 3d model" );
00043   connect(myAction,SIGNAL(triggered()),this,SLOT(slotModelFromFile()));
00044   myMenu->addAction( myAction );
00045   
00046   /*
00047   **    // do next: show segments one at a time
00048   **    nextAction = new QAction ( "Do next", this );
00049   **    nextAction->setShortcut(QString("Ctrl+."));
00050   **    nextAction->setStatusTip ( "Do next" );
00051   **    connect(nextAction, SIGNAL(triggered()),this,SLOT(myNextMenuItem()));
00052   **    myMenu->addAction( nextAction );
00053   */
00054 
00055   uio::mb()->insertMenu(uio::hm(),myMenu);
00056   //cout << "g2m ctor end" << endl;
00057 }

00062 void g2m::slotModelFromFile()
00063 {

00070   if ( ! file.endsWith(".ngc") ) {

00072     return;
00073   }

00091 
00092 void g2m::interpret() {
00093   success = false;
00094   //FIXME: don't hardcode these paths
00095   QString ipath = "/opt/src/emc2/trunk/";
00096   QString interp = ipath + "bin/rs274";
00097   QString iparm = ipath + "configs/sim/sim_mm.var\n";
00098   QString itool = ipath + "configs/sim/sim_mm.tbl\n";
00099   QProcess toCanon;
00100   bool foundEOF;
00101   toCanon.start(interp,QStringList(file));
00102   /**************************************************
00103   Apparently, QProcess::setReadChannel screws with waitForReadyRead() and canReadLine()
00104   So, we just fly blind and assume that there are no errors when we navigate
00105   the interp's "menu", and that it requires no delays.
00106   **************************************************/
00107   
00108   //now give the interpreter the data it needs
00109   toCanon.write("2\n"); //set parameter file
00110   toCanon.write(iparm.toAscii());
00111   toCanon.write("3\n"); //set tool table file
00112   toCanon.write(itool.toAscii());
00113   //can also use 4 and 5
00114   
00115   toCanon.write("1\n"); //start interpreting
00116   //cout << "stderr: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardError() << endl;
00117   
00118   if (!toCanon.waitForReadyRead(1000) ) {
00119     if ( toCanon.state() == QProcess::NotRunning ){
00120       infoMsg("Interpreter died.  Bad tool table " + itool + " ?");
00121     } else  infoMsg("Interpreter timed out for an unknown reason.");
00122     cout << "stderr: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardError() << endl;
00123     cout << "stdout: " << (const char*)toCanon.readAllStandardOutput() << endl;
00124     toCanon.close();
00125     return;
00126   }
00127   
00128   //if readLine is used at the wrong time, it is possible to pick up a line fragment! will canReadLine() fix that?
00129   qint64 lineLength;
00130   char line[260];
00131   uint fails = 0;
00132   do {
00133     if (toCanon.canReadLine()) {
00134       lineLength = toCanon.readLine(line, sizeof(line));
00135       if (lineLength != -1 ) {
00136         foundEOF = processCanonLine(line);
00137       } else {  //shouldn't get here!
00138         fails++;
00139         sleepSecond();
00140     }
00141   } else {
00142     fails++;
00143     sleepSecond();
00144   }
00145 } while ( (fails < 100) && 
00146 ( (toCanon.canReadLine()) || ( toCanon.state() != QProcess::NotRunning ) )  );
00147 //((lineLength > 0) ||  //loop until interp quits and all lines are read.
00148 //toCanon.canReadLine() ||  
00149 success = foundEOF;
00150 return;
00151 }
00152 
00153 bool g2m::processCanonLine (std::string l) {
00154   
00155   //create the object and get its pointer
00156   canonLine * cl = canonLine::canonLineFactory
00157   (l,*lineVector.back()->getStatus());
00158   //store it
00159   lineVector.push_back(cl);
00160   return cl->checkErrors();
00161 }
00162 
00163 void g2m::sleepSecond() {
00164   //sleep 1s and process events
00165   //cout << "SLEEP..." << endl;
00166   QTime dieTime = QTime::currentTime().addSecs(1);
00167   while( QTime::currentTime() < dieTime )
00168     QCoreApplication::processEvents(QEventLoop::ExcludeUserInputEvents, 100);
00169   return;
00170 }
00171 
00172 void g2m::infoMsg(QString s) {
00173   cout << s.toStdString() << endl;
00174 }
